<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/finance-bigwigs-tech-execs-reddit-investor-testify-capitol-hill?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You're Probably Wondering How He Got Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/finance-bigwigs-tech-execs-reddit-investor-testify-capitol-hill" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Roaring Kitty " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTAxL3JvYXJpbmdfa2l0dHkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>US House of Representatives screenshot</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Billionaires, tech executives, and a YouTuber walk into a government hearing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The punchline is less funny than you'd hope. Yesterday's <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-retail-trading-usa-congress/robinhood-hedge-fund-chiefs-grilled-by-lawmakers-over-gamestop-reddit-rally-idUSKBN2AI1C4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual hearing</a>, called by the House Financial Services Committee to better understand the astonishing surge in GameStop shares a few weeks ago, resembled a 9–3 football game in the rain—lots of defense and not particularly fun to watch. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, it was perhaps the most high-profile discussion of an important development we've been charting for years: the growing influence of individual investors and social media in the stock market. And there were some interesting takeaways.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tenev takes the heat: </strong>Many questions from lawmakers were directed at Vlad Tenev, CEO of Robinhood. The company limited trading of certain stocks and has been criticized for "gamifying" investing at the expense of the inexperienced investor. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tenev apologized for the pause in trading but otherwise defended his firm's business model, which includes the controversial practice of "</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-02-05/robinhood-gamestop-saga-pressures-payment-for-order-flow?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">payment for order flow</a></span><span>" (PFOF). </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tenev and Ken Griffin, the billionaire founder of Citadel, both said that PFOF allows for innovation in the industry, such as the no-commission trades pioneered by Robinhood.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Roaring Kitty still loves GameStop: </strong>In his <a href="https://financialservices.house.gov/uploadedfiles/hhrg-117-ba00-wstate-gillk-20210218.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opening statement</a>, Keith "Roaring Kitty" Gill, the trader who is credited with sparking major interest in the retailer, said, "In short, I like the stock." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When asked about new regulations to protect individual investors, Gill said he didn't think any new rules were needed, just "increased transparency." </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He also delivered the best line of the event (in our opinion) when he declared, "I am not a cat," in reference to the </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s-frHneo95k&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">viral video</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best of the rest: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reddit’s CEO said investment advice on the platform is “probably among the best.”   </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lawmakers argued among themselves whether the hearing was “political theater” or “serious oversight.”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Griffin denied conspiracy theories that Citadel and Robinhood colluded to limit trading in GameStop. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Hedge fund manager Gabe Plotkin summed up the entire episode best when he said that his industry will have to adapt to the rise of the retail investor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Further reading (and listening):</strong></p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Get to know the </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/get-know-gamestop-hearings-five-key-witnesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">five key witnesses</a></span><span> at the hearing.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Two </span><span><em>Business Casual </em></span><span>podcast episodes about GameStop. The guests are: 1) </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/the-gamestop-saga-how-no-fee-trading-engineered-both-access-chaos/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jannick Malling</a></span><span>, cofounder and co-CEO of investing social network Public and 2) </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/if-the-stock-market-is-broken-who-can-fix-it/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a></span><span>, who edits this newsletter every day and has been told he has a "podcast voice." </span>
</li>
</ol>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/whats-going-big-tech-publishers-australia?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Thunder Down Under: It's a News Fight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/whats-going-big-tech-publishers-australia?email={{profile.email}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ben Stiller in Anchorman licking his lips" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=350 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/12OOqKXAALhAkM/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Ben Stiller in Anchorman licking his lips" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/12OOqKXAALhAkM/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the US copes with winter weather, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/google-facebook-australia-explained-55ce7a524855c2cdabdf8ca82ad2c8cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another storm</a> is brewing 10,000 miles away over how to divide revenue among news publishers and Big Tech. A proposed law is winding through Australia's Parliament that would require social platforms like Facebook and Google to make revenue-sharing agreements with publishers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Both platforms are against the law</strong>—but made opposite tactical moves this week. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google threw proponents a bone, striking agreements with Australian publishers, while Facebook threw a stick, blocking news sharing on its services in Australia. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Their argument: Forcing platforms to pay for news would threaten the open internet. Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the World Wide Web, </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-europe-australia-media-journalism-771b10a4efd00d47a703655708f45e57?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> the law would indeed compromise his invention. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Publishers' POV: </strong>Over the course of the digital revolution, platforms have eaten publishers' lunch, and dinner, and post-dinner snack. Google accounts for 53% of online advertising revenue in Australia, while Facebook eats up another 23%, per the country's treasurer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>However things shake out in Australia, the idea of making platforms share $$$ with publishers is gaining traction elsewhere, including the EU and the UK. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/walmart-raises-wages-mcdonalds-links-exec-pay-diversity-targets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
HR Watch
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/walmart-raises-wages-mcdonalds-links-exec-pay-diversity-targets" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Walmart sign rewritten to say "Great Workplace"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTcvd2FsbWFydF9ncmVhdF93b3JrcGxhY2Vfc2lnbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three major retailers announced changes on the labor front yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Walmart</strong> is <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walmart-raises-wages-for-425000-store-associates-121301438.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising wages</a> for 425,000 store associates following a successful holiday season. Depending on location, wages will bump up to $13–$19/hour.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With the increase, almost half of Walmart's US employees will earn $15/hour or more. But Walmart's $11/hour starting wage won't budge for now, even though competitors including Amazon, Target, and Costco have increased theirs to $15.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Kroger</strong> is <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kroger-hazard-pay-law-seattle-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a> some Seattle stores due to a new ordinance requiring $4/hour hazard pay for frontline grocery workers. Kroger had "hero pay" when the pandemic began, then switched to one-time bonuses of up to $400.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kroger is also closing two stores in California, where a handful of cities have passed similar measures. California's grocer association is fighting the rules.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">McDonald's</strong> is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/18/mcdonalds-sets-targets-to-diversify-its-leadership-seeks-gender-parity-by-2030.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">linking</a> executive VP bonuses to diversity targets. The fast food chain wants to improve representation in senior leadership to 45% women and 35% minorities by 2025. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY M1 FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Time in the Market vs. Timing the Market
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.m1finance.com/brew/" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="M1 Finance" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=335 src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/c/h/5fdbf3e93d10f.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="M1 Finance" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/c/h/5fdbf3e93d10f.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These days, there’s a <em>lot </em>of hype around day trading. But sometimes, identifying and committing to a good old fashioned <strong style="color:#000">long-term strategy</strong> is one of the best ways to build wealth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So says <a href="https://www.m1finance.com/brew/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">M1, the Finance Super App</a> that was built with <strong style="color:#000">your financial well-being</strong> top of noggin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">M1 doesn’t believe that riding the bucking bronco of speculating and day trading is a viable path to building long-term wealth, so they built <a href="https://www.m1finance.com/brew/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a hassle-free, distraction-free, and management fee-free app</a> to <strong style="color:#000">easily invest, borrow, and spend</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All you have to do is settle on a strategy, automate it, and then go on livin’ your life while <a href="https://www.m1finance.com/brew/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">M1 takes care of the day-to-day</a>. Whaddaya say compadre?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Get $30</strong> when you <a href="https://www.m1finance.com/brew/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up and fund your account with $1,000 today</a>.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/key-performance-indicators" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ryan Duffy's drone shot of Austin, TX</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Running back our new section with one quote, one stat, and one read.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"Seconds and minutes”—Texas officials said the state was <a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2021/02/18/texas-power-outages-ercot/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>this </em>close</a> to an uncontrolled blackout, a worst-case scenario where households could have lost power for months. Early on Monday morning, grid operators made the decision to intentionally cut power to prevent the system from being completely overwhelmed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Tanger Outlets said traffic was <a href="https://investors.tangeroutlet.com/press-releases/news-details/2021/Tanger-Reports-Fourth-Quarter-And-Full-Year-Results/default.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 90%</a> of last year's levels in Q4. And in January, traffic at its US shopping centers was more than 99% of last year's levels <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/thinking-face_1f914.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The NHL has a huge problem—its goalies are too big. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2021/02/hockey-goalies-are-too-big-now/618021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>) </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At around 4pm ET yesterday, NASA's most sophisticated rover yet, Perseverance, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/nasa-rover-lands-on-mars-62f78481fe746cd7d0e41e28969a2c5a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">landed on Mars</a>. It will spend at least one Mars year—687 Earth days—searching for signs of ancient life on the red planet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It has a friend waiting: NASA's Curiosity rover, which landed on Mars in 2012. Perseverance will have to explain GameStop, Clubhouse, and Matthew McConnaghey's career turnaround. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Texas: </strong>Learn about the energy crisis from Emerging Tech Brew writer Ryan Duffy's <a href="https://twitter.com/RyanfDuffy/status/1362435585646936064?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter thread</a>, then look through this <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/11GplfTTLRv6yV-2AC6GFw5Gy4izlPdGSay1HdRQcRjQ/preview?pru=AAABd9XQ3Vc*3azIux-6snVgumqdZ_D7hA&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google doc</a> or <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CLaQmrlBaPS/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this Instagram post</a> for ways to help. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Friday:</strong> TikToker <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@alex.ivanchak?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">alex.ivanchak</a> creates celebrity portraits out of Rubik's cubes. It's really cool. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Free film: </strong>You can watch <em>The Trial of the Chicago 7</em> on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWOA1ZGywLbqmigxE4Qlvuw?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Netflix's YouTube channel</a>, this weekend only.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Friday, we unleashed the most epic Friday Puzzle in the history of Fridays—and puzzles. We asked readers to fill out an 8x8 grid with company names, such that the companies’ market values, when added together, were the greatest possible combination. Our winner: Drew Howerton with a market cap of $9.762 trillion. That LGAM square is clever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDk5L2Nyb3Nzd29yZF9hbnN3ZXIucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 270px;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We won't leave you without a puzzle to do today. What same three letters fit into the following blanks in the same order to form five words?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. E _ _ _ P<br>2. _ _ _ C K<br>3. S _ _ _ S H<br>4. L I _ _ _ D<br>5. T E _ _ _ L A</p>

screenshot\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBillionaires, tech executives, and a YouTuber walk into a government hearing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe punchline is less funny than you'd hope. Yesterday's \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-retail-trading-usa-congress/robinhood-hedge-fund-chiefs-grilled-by-lawmakers-over-gamestop-reddit-rally-idUSKBN2AI1C4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual hearing\u003c/a\u003e, called by the House Financial Services Committee to better understand the astonishing surge in GameStop shares a few weeks ago, resembled a 9–3 football game in the rain—lots of defense and not particularly fun to watch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, it was perhaps the most high-profile discussion of an important development we've been charting for years: the growing influence of individual investors and social media in the stock market. And there were some interesting takeaways.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTenev takes the heat: \u003c/strong\u003eMany questions from lawmakers were directed at Vlad Tenev, CEO of Robinhood. The company limited trading of certain stocks and has been criticized for \"gamifying\" investing at the expense of the inexperienced investor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTenev apologized for the pause in trading but otherwise defended his firm's business model, which includes the controversial practice of \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-02-05/robinhood-gamestop-saga-pressures-payment-for-order-flow?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epayment for order flow\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" (PFOF). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTenev and Ken Griffin, the billionaire founder of Citadel, both said that PFOF allows for innovation in the industry, such as the no-commission trades pioneered by Robinhood.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRoaring Kitty still loves GameStop: \u003c/strong\u003eIn his \u003ca href=\"https://financialservices.house.gov/uploadedfiles/hhrg-117-ba00-wstate-gillk-20210218.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopening statement\u003c/a\u003e, Keith \"Roaring Kitty\" Gill, the trader who is credited with sparking major interest in the retailer, said, \"In short, I like the stock.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen asked about new regulations to protect individual investors, Gill said he didn't think any new rules were needed, just \"increased transparency.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe also delivered the best line of the event (in our opinion) when he declared, \"I am not a cat,\" in reference to the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s-frHneo95k\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eviral video\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBest of the rest: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReddit’s CEO said investment advice on the platform is “probably among the best.”   \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLawmakers argued among themselves whether the hearing was “political theater” or “serious oversight.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGriffin denied conspiracy theories that Citadel and Robinhood colluded to limit trading in GameStop. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eHedge fund manager Gabe Plotkin summed up the entire episode best when he said that his industry will have to adapt to the rise of the retail investor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the US copes with winter weather, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/google-facebook-australia-explained-55ce7a524855c2cdabdf8ca82ad2c8cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanother storm\u003c/a\u003e is brewing 10,000 miles away over how to divide revenue among news publishers and Big Tech. A proposed law is winding through Australia's Parliament that would require social platforms like Facebook and Google to make revenue-sharing agreements with publishers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBoth platforms are against the law\u003c/strong\u003e—but made opposite tactical moves this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoogle threw proponents a bone, striking agreements with Australian publishers, while Facebook threw a stick, blocking news sharing on its services in Australia. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTheir argument: Forcing platforms to pay for news would threaten the open internet. Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the World Wide Web, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-europe-australia-media-journalism-771b10a4efd00d47a703655708f45e57?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the law would indeed compromise his invention. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePublishers' POV: \u003c/strong\u003eOver the course of the digital revolution, platforms have eaten publishers' lunch, and dinner, and post-dinner snack. Google accounts for 53% of online advertising revenue in Australia, while Facebook eats up another 23%, per the country's treasurer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eHowever things shake out in Australia, the idea of making platforms share $$$ with publishers is gaining traction elsewhere, including the EU and the UK. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThree major retailers announced changes on the labor front yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWalmart\u003c/strong\u003e is \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walmart-raises-wages-for-425000-store-associates-121301438.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraising wages\u003c/a\u003e for 425,000 store associates following a successful holiday season. Depending on location, wages will bump up to $13–$19/hour.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith the increase, almost half of Walmart's US employees will earn $15/hour or more. But Walmart's $11/hour starting wage won't budge for now, even though competitors including Amazon, Target, and Costco have increased theirs to $15.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKroger\u003c/strong\u003e is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kroger-hazard-pay-law-seattle-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosing\u003c/a\u003e some Seattle stores due to a new ordinance requiring $4/hour hazard pay for frontline grocery workers. Kroger had \"hero pay\" when the pandemic began, then switched to one-time bonuses of up to $400.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKroger is also closing two stores in California, where a handful of cities have passed similar measures. California's grocer association is fighting the rules.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMcDonald's\u003c/strong\u003e is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/18/mcdonalds-sets-targets-to-diversify-its-leadership-seeks-gender-parity-by-2030.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elinking\u003c/a\u003e executive VP bonuses to diversity targets. The fast food chain wants to improve representation in senior leadership to 45% women and 35% minorities by 2025. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
